title: (x) "Die falschen Teilnehmer" squarish sans - Nuri {Urban One}
content:
Thanks! | Danke!

 [‹ (x) freeware font used on Jim Sweetwater website - Sneakout {Nicolai}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071030193548/http:/typophile.com/node/19189 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Everbloom logo - Kravitz Thermal {Stephen} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071030193548/http:/typophile.com/node/19187 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Till

comments.content: This one has some [Zemestro](http://web.archive.org/web/20071030193548/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=M.118552.0.3&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Die+falsche+Teilnehmer&sampleSize=32) flavour but it isn’t.

[Sophisto](http://web.archive.org/web/20071030193548/http:/macrhino.com/), by Stefan Hattenbach, has a similar “squarish” feel, except for the period…

—————-  
nc

A watered-down clone of Sophisto is [Rui Abreu](http://web.archive.org/web/20071030193548/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Rui%252BAbreu)’s [Tirana](http://web.archive.org/web/20071030193548/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/display.php?f_id=855). I’m not too happy about that one — it borders on plagiarism. :^/

Have a look at the Nuri Typefamily...

[http://www.rocholl-projects.de/pdf/nuri.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20071030193548/http:/www.rocholl-projects.de/pdf/nuri.pdf "http://www.rocholl-projects.de/pdf/nuri.pdf")

I think you haven’t seen Tirana carefully enough, it has a completly different feeling to it. I really don’t see why you think that Tirana is a clone of Sophisto. You shoud be more careful before accusing others of plagiarism. T26 has a Typesetter [http://www.t26.com/fonts/display.php?f\_id=855](http://web.archive.org/web/20071030193548/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/display.php?f_id=855 "http://www.t26.com/fonts/display.php?f\_id=855") I think you should check it.
Urban One got it correct, it’s Nuri. Seems we had this one just recently...

Well, I must say that when I first saw the typeface announced in the T-26 newsletter, I immediately noticed all the similarities, especially in the name Tirana which was displayed quite big.

Of course this is an original font, but it borrows heavily on shapes, curves and design motifs as seen in Sophisto. This is not the first time this happens BTW — [Kautiva](http://web.archive.org/web/20071030193548/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts-kautiva.htm) also suffers from this, albeit to a lesser extent.
